item.title: Modifying the Hosts File in a Docker Container
item.author: Sam Stelfox
item.description: Before I describe the issue that I encountered, let me be very clear. This hack is potentially dangerous and should absolutely only be done in development environments. This won’t affect your host system, only the docker container so the most damage you’ll do is prevent hostname and possibly user/group lookups within the container itself. Alright with that out of the way, I was actively working on a codebase that uses subdomains as part of the identifier.
